docs.snippet: There are similarities between how Islamists and white nationalists operate online, researchers said. Those can be used to limit recruitment’s reach.

headline.main: A Hunt for Ways to Combat Online Radicalization

docs.snippet: Ms. Wall, a journalist, disappeared after boarding a submarine designed by Peter Madsen, who says he buried her at sea after an accident on the vessel.

headline.print_headline: Danish Police Say Torso Belonged to Journalist

docs.snippet: Until now, Muslim men in the country could end their marriage by saying the Arabic word “talaq” three times. Women had no such right.

headline.print_headline: India Strikes Down ‘Instant Divorce’ for Muslims
headline.main: India’s Supreme Court Strikes Down ‘Instant Divorce’ for Muslims

docs.snippet: Brockton, Mass., was consumed with reports of an imminent sweep by ICE, as the news filtered through neighborhoods, social media and even cable news.

headline.print_headline: ‘Don’t Open  the Door’:  Fear of a Raid Grips Migrants

docs.snippet: A photographer went from taking the picture of a Marine under fire to collaborating with him on a book about war and its emotional aftermath.

headline.main: After Combat, a Photographer and a Marine Find Common Ground

docs.snippet: A reader responds to a misstated metaphor, an author defends his work and more.
